issue.title: Qt 0.17.0rc4 (and master) not running on Ubuntu 14.04.5 LTS
issue.body:
Not sure if this is a problem.

Qt 0.16.3 runs successful on Ubuntu Trusty (14.04.5).
However, Qt 0.17.0rc4 (and master) gives me `undefined symbol: FT_Get_Font_Format`:

0.17.0rc4:
```
user@ubuntu:~/Desktop$ lsb_release -a
No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
Description:	Ubuntu 14.04.5 LTS
Release:	14.04
Codename:	trusty
user@ubuntu:~/Desktop$ ./bitcoin-qt --regtest
./bitcoin-qt: symbol lookup error: ./bitcoin-qt: undefined symbol: FT_Get_Font_Format
```

events.body:
Could you please dump the output of ```ldd bitcoin-qt``` as well as ```readelf -d bitcoin-qt``` ?

Looks like the Fontconfig abi might've changed :\

```
user@ubuntu:~/Desktop$ ldd ./bitcoin-qt 
	linux-vdso.so.1 =>  (0x00007ffef759f000)
	libpthread.so.0 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libpthread.so.0 (0x00007f8e3a444000)
	libdl.so.2 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libdl.so.2 (0x00007f8e3a240000)
	libm.so.6 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libm.so.6 (0x00007f8e39f3a000)
	libfontconfig.so.1 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libfontconfig.so.1 (0x00007f8e39cfd000)
	libfreetype.so.6 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libfreetype.so.6 (0x00007f8e39a5a000)
	libX11-xcb.so.1 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libX11-xcb.so.1 (0x00007f8e39858000)
	libX11.so.6 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libX11.so.6 (0x00007f8e39522000)
	libxcb.so.1 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libxcb.so.1 (0x00007f8e39303000)
	librt.so.1 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/librt.so.1 (0x00007f8e390fb000)
	libgcc_s.so.1 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgcc_s.so.1 (0x00007f8e38ee4000)
	libc.so.6 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6 (0x00007f8e38b1b000)
	/lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x000055f422e5b000)
	libexpat.so.1 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libexpat.so.1 (0x00007f8e388f1000)
	libz.so.1 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libz.so.1 (0x00007f8e386d7000)
	libpng12.so.0 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libpng12.so.0 (0x00007f8e384b1000)
	libXau.so.6 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libXau.so.6 (0x00007f8e382ad000)
	libXdmcp.so.6 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libXdmcp.so.6 (0x00007f8e380a6000)
```

```
user@ubuntu:~/Desktop$ readelf -d ./bitcoin-qt 

Dynamic section at offset 0x21e7308 contains 38 entries:
  Tag        Type                         Name/Value
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libpthread.so.0]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libdl.so.2]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libm.so.6]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libfontconfig.so.1]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libfreetype.so.6]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libX11-xcb.so.1]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libX11.so.6]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libxcb.so.1]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [librt.so.1]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libgcc_s.so.1]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libc.so.6]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [ld-linux-x86-64.so.2]
 0x000000000000000c (INIT)               0x144118
 0x000000000000000d (FINI)               0x15d8260
 0x0000000000000019 (INIT_ARRAY)         0x2363358
 0x000000000000001b (INIT_ARRAYSZ)       1464 (bytes)
 0x000000000000001a (FINI_ARRAY)         0x2363910
 0x000000000000001c (FINI_ARRAYSZ)       16 (bytes)
 0x000000006ffffef5 (GNU_HASH)           0x2d0
 0x0000000000000005 (STRTAB)             0x3e80
 0x0000000000000006 (SYMTAB)             0x310
 0x000000000000000a (STRSZ)              8630 (bytes)
 0x000000000000000b (SYMENT)             24 (bytes)
 0x0000000000000015 (DEBUG)              0x0
 0x0000000000000003 (PLTGOT)             0x23e75a8
 0x0000000000000002 (PLTRELSZ)           14544 (bytes)
 0x0000000000000014 (PLTREL)             RELA
 0x0000000000000017 (JMPREL)             0x140848
 0x0000000000000007 (RELA)               0x6700
 0x0000000000000008 (RELASZ)             1286472 (bytes)
 0x0000000000000009 (RELAENT)            24 (bytes)
 0x000000000000001e (FLAGS)              BIND_NOW
 0x000000006ffffffb (FLAGS_1)            Flags: NOW 8000000
 0x000000006ffffffe (VERNEED)            0x6530
 0x000000006fffffff (VERNEEDNUM)         7
 0x000000006ffffff0 (VERSYM)             0x6036
 0x000000006ffffff9 (RELACOUNT)          53576
 0x0000000000000000 (NULL)               0x0
```

This is an issue with qt's usage of freetype.

A few years ago, libfreetype introduced FT_Get_Font_Format as an alias for FT_Get_X11_Font_Format, but FT_Get_X11_Font_Format was kept for back-compat.

Our last qt bump introduced a call to FT_Get_Font_Format. I think that if it used the old name, it would be back-compat to older runtime freetype libs.

@jonasschnelli Can you give this quick (untested) hack a try?
```patch
diff --git a/depends/packages/qt.mk b/depends/packages/qt.mk
index 5286f89..d15f147 100644
--- a/depends/packages/qt.mk
+++ b/depends/packages/qt.mk
@@ -120,6 +120,7 @@ define $(package)_extract_cmds
 endef

 define $(package)_preprocess_cmds
+  sed -i.old "s|FT_Get_Font_Format|FT_Get_X11_Font_Format|" qtbase/src/platformsupport/fontdatabases/freetype/qfontengine_ft.cpp && \
   sed -i.old "s|updateqm.commands = \$$$$\$$$$LRELEASE|updateqm.commands = $($(package)_extract_dir)/qttools/bin/lrelease|" qttranslations/translations/translations.pro && \
   sed -i.old "/updateqm.depends =/d" qttranslations/translations/translations.pro && \
   sed -i.old "s/src_plugins.depends = src_sql src_network/src_plugins.depends = src_network/" qtbase/src/src.pro && \
```

@theuni I spun up a new 14.04.5 Ubuntu VM and cloned af4b8a3. Doing a depends build, and running `bitcoin-qt` results in the same error as @jonasschnelli (`make check` fails): ![14 04 5-master-depends-build](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/863730/46209040-39925180-c35f-11e8-9dc2-92def0d2ff8d.png) After applying your patch and re-building, `make check` passes and `bitcoin-qt` runs: That's all I tested.
@fanquake Thanks for testing! I'll prepare a PR.
